name: TSSG 2024 Wargame Report (from Mock)
description: Analysis of trilateral military cooperation and cultural influences on decision-making.

elements.title: Purpose
elements.content: This report provides an overview of key objectives, game design, analysis findings, and opportunities for future research following the 2024 Trilateral Strategic Steering Group (TSSG) Wargame. The wargame aimed to characterize military cultural fluency and explore challenges in combined Air Force-level decision-making across allied French, UK, and US military participants.

name: TSSG 2024 Wargame Report
description: Analysis of trilateral military cooperation and cultural influences on decision-making.

elements.title: Purpose
elements.content: This report provides an overview of key objectives, game design, analysis findings, and opportunities for future research following the 2024 Trilateral Strategic Steering Group (TSSG) Wargame. The wargame aimed to characterize military cultural fluency and explore challenges in combined Air Force-level decision-making across allied French, UK, and US military participants.

elements.title: Key Findings
elements.content:
Language barriers and cultural differences significantly influence communication and decision-making
Distinct national characteristics create both challenges and complementary effects
Shared values and camaraderie foster strong team orientations

elements.title: Purpose
elements.content: Provide an overview of key objectives, game design, analysis findings, and opportunities for future research following the 2024 Trilateral Strategic Steering Group (TSSG) Wargame. The wargame aimed to characterize military cultural fluency and explore challenges in combined Air Force-level decision-making across allied French, UK, and US military participants.

elements.title: Background
elements.content: The French Air Chief hosted the TSSG Wargame at Ã‰cole Militaire in Paris, France, from 28-31 May 2024. French, UK, and US Air Force officers gathered as allied collaborators to improve military cultural fluency and explore differences in decision-making approaches.

elements.title: Game Execution
elements.content: The United States Air Force Wargaming Institute executed the game, bringing together 18 players from the three nations. They practiced decision-making in a custom-designed environment, using a modified version of the Air Force Wargame Indo-Pacific.

elements.title: Demographics
elements.content:
All 18 players were from the air forces of their respective country
Majority were field-grade level, with two senior level players
Time in Service: Approximately half had 10-20 years, half had 20-30 years
Functional Areas: Nine aircrew, two engineers, two intelligence officers, remaining logistics or C2 SMEs
Multinational Experience: About 75% had combined planning staff experience, 33% had exchange tours
Language Proficiency: US/UK players had limited proficiency, French players had higher proficiency levels

elements.title: Game Design Overview
elements.content: The game design purpose was to improve military cultural fluency and explore differences in decision-making approaches. The design included a Diplomatic, Informational, Military, Economic (DIME) investment phase and a warfighting phase, using the Air Force Wargame Indo-Pacific.

elements.title: Game Design Features
elements.content:
Modified version of Air Force Wargame Indo-Pacific
Added team construct for blue player
Included French and UK military assets
Implemented three questionnaires for data capture
Used observer teams to document player interactions

elements.title: Language Barriers and Culture
elements.content: The wargame reinforced that language barriers and cultural differences can significantly influence communication and decision-making, especially during team formation and the creation/reinforcement of sub-optimal team dynamics. Lack of shared language skills often led to voluntary disengagement.

elements.title: National Characteristics
elements.content: Distinct national characteristics created team formation challenges and affected decision-making timelines. However, the net assessment showed a positive appreciation for complementary effects that fostered enhanced operational effectiveness.

elements.title: Shared Values and Camaraderie
elements.content: Trilateral allies valued individualism and free societies, fostering strong team orientations. Participants repeatedly expressed mutual respect and appreciation for shared values, facilitating smoother cooperation and decision-making.

elements.title: Decision-Making Approaches
elements.content:
French participants favored a mix of autocratic and consultative approaches
UK players balanced consultative and consensus approaches
US participants leaned toward decisive and somewhat autocratic approaches

elements.title: Risk Tolerance
elements.content:
French players favored balanced collaborative approach, prioritizing consensus
UK players had thorough risk mitigation with extensive planning
US teams opted for decisive military actions, often driven by minority leaders

elements.title: Communication Styles
elements.content:
French participants used formal and indirect communication
UK participants blended formality with directness
US participants favored direct and informal communication

elements.title: Recommendations
elements.content:
Engage in Cross Cultural Investment Programs (exchange tours both at operational and strategic staff level and in professional military education systems)
Develop French and RAF organizations focused on cultural and language proficiency, similar to AFCLC
Coordinate team building events using wargaming to increase cultural awareness across key staff members
Implement talent management considerations for personnel who engage in cross-cultural competency programs

elements.title: Conclusion
elements.content: The TSSG Wargame successfully demonstrated how cultural factors significantly influence military planning and decision-making processes. The exercise revealed that national characteristics, while presenting initial challenges, ultimately contribute to more robust and comprehensive operational solutions when properly understood and leveraged.

elements.title: Key Outcomes
elements.content:
Enhanced problem-solving through multiple cultural perspectives
Improved risk assessment through varied national approaches
Strengthened coalition operations through better cultural understanding
30% increase in players' familiarity with cross-national assets/capabilities
Significant reduction in decision-making delays during combined operations
